the UC Board of Regents granted full approval for the construction of a 250room hotel located in the heart of the UCLA campus last month PERIOD

The Boards Committee on Grounds and Buildings unanimously approved support for construction of the  square foot Luskin Conference and Guest Center which will be located in center campus and in the current site of a parking structure PERIOD With construction slated to begin Sep PERIOD  and expected to conclude in winter of  the projects estimated cost is  million PERIOD

Named after Meyer and Renee Luskin the UCLA alumni who donated  million toward construction the project will include a conference center and hotel guest rooms as well as an underground parking garage with  spaces and a catering kitchen PERIOD Development will also include improvements to pedestrian areas and nearby roads located in Gateway Plaza PERIOD

The Luskins donation will be distributed into two pools of funding with  million spent on construction and  million going towards programs the center will support such as rental costs for campus departments and programs using the space PERIOD

According to a press release the hotel will be exclusively for clients visiting the university as it offers reasonably priced meeting spaces and hotel rooms for these guests with rates estimated at  per night PERIOD Furthermore the campusbased nature of the hotel is not expected to affect any outside businesses in the Westwood area PERIOD

The campus still needs another  million of the costs to be financed which UCLA plans to retrieve from sources outside of student fees and state funding PERIOD

Finalized design plans and an environmental impact report which include public opinions about the project like the controversy surrounding its potential to take revenue from local businesses have been compiled PERIOD On Sep PERIOD  the Regents committee reported its official certification of the Environmental Impact Report under the California Environmental Quality Act as well as their adoption of the reports findings into the Luskin Centers plans PERIOD

The Luskins have aided in the establishment of the Meyer and Renee Luskin School of Public Affairs and the Luskin Center for Innovation at UCLA PERIOD Along with creating endowment funds for both undergraduate student scholarships and graduate student fellowships at UCLA the Luskin family has donated to the childrens clinic at the UCLA Medical Center and Orthopedic Hospital as well as the UCLA Alumni Association and related advisory boards PERIOD
